newsitem.title: USA: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell adds to junk bond team.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell adds to junk bond team.

text.p: Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Inc announced it has hired Tom Glover, formerly an investment banker at Goldman, Sachs & Co, to head up its high-yield bond origination team in New York.
Additionally, Peter Nason, who is currently managing director of corporate bond trading at Deutsche, will take over responsiblity for junk bond trading, the firm announced.
Deutsche is in the process of building a new high-yield department. Recently, the firm hired several research analysts for the group.

In his new position, Glover will report to both Grant Kvalheim, managing director and co-head of global debt capital markets, and C. Edward Carter, managing director and head of Deutsche's investment-banking division in North America.
Deutsche Morgan Grenfell is the investment banking arm of Deutsche Bank AG.
